title: Find Missing Number

videos.title: Missing Number - XOR Bit Manipulation - Leetcode 268

patternTriggers: Use Cyclic Sort or Math/XOR when array of n numbers contains [0,n-1] or [1,n] with one missing. Key indicators: consecutive numbers with one gap, O(1) space preferred, can use sum formula or XOR properties.

approaches.name: Brute Force (Linear Search)
approaches.intuition: Check for each number from 0 to n whether it exists in the array. The number that doesn't exist is the missing one.
approaches.approach: For each number in range [0,n], search through array to see if it exists.
steps: For each number from 0 to n:

complexity.timeExplanation: For each of (n+1) numbers, search through array of size n: (n+1)*n = O(n²)
complexity.spaceExplanation: Only using constant space for variables

approaches.name: Better (Sum Formula / Hash Set)
approaches.intuition: The sum of numbers from 0 to n is n*(n+1)/2. Calculate this expected sum, then subtract the actual sum of array elements. The difference is the missing number. Alternative: use hash set for O(1) lookups.
approaches.approach: Calculate expected sum using formula, calculate actual sum from array, return difference.
steps: Calculate actual sum of array elements

complexity.timeExplanation: Single pass through array to calculate sum
complexity.spaceExplanation: Only using constant space for sum variables

code.python:
def missing_number(nums):
    n = len(nums)
    
    # Calculate expected sum: 0+1+2+...+n = n*(n+1)/2
    expected_sum = n * (n + 1) // 2
    
    # Calculate actual sum
    actual_sum = sum(nums)
    
    # Missing number is the difference
    return expected_sum - actual_sum

approaches.name: Optimal (XOR or Cyclic Sort)
approaches.intuition: XOR approach: XOR all numbers from 0 to n with all array elements. Duplicates cancel out (a^a=0), leaving only the missing number. Cyclic Sort: Place each number at its index, then find which index has wrong number.
approaches.approach: XOR all indices (0 to n) with all array values. The result is the missing number due to XOR cancellation property.
steps: For each index i from 0 to n-1:
XOR result with i: result ^= i
XOR result with nums[i]: result ^= nums[i]

complexity.timeExplanation: Single pass through array with constant time XOR operations
complexity.spaceExplanation: Only using one variable to store result

code.python:
def missing_number(nums):
    n = len(nums)
    result = n  # Start with n
    
    # XOR all indices and values
    for i in range(n):
        result ^= i         # XOR with index
        result ^= nums[i]   # XOR with value
    
    # Result contains the missing number
    return result

commonMistakes: Forgetting that numbers are from 0 to n (not 1 to n) so there are n+1 total numbers
Integer overflow when calculating sum for large n (use long or XOR instead)
Not initializing result with n when using XOR approach
Confusing index i with value nums[i] in XOR approach
Using wrong sum formula: should be n*(n+1)/2 not n*(n-1)/2
Not handling edge case when n=0 (array is empty, missing is 0)
